intro: ^Late spring. The Laketown Docks, SSW edge of the Evermore Ruent Basin.

g-2: ^Troy, Alexis, Julian and Mia meet for a day of boating on Evermore Ruent Basin, a large, freshwater lake. Locals just call it "the lake."
g-3: ^The lake is large, covering some 22,000 square miles. Though generally placid, it has both waves and strong currents, and often suffers from sudden gusts of wind. These factors make navigating it a task for an experienced, safety-conscious boater.

s0: ^The boating experience among the group of friends ranges from high to low. Mia is newest to boating. As the group travels down to the dock where the boat is moored,
^Mia quizzes the others on their experience.
s1: ^Mia quizzes the others on their experience.
s3: ^Mia, reassured, explains how she feels to the others.

intro_troy: ^"You don't need to worry. I grew up on the shores of Strar Lake. My brother Vincent and I spent as much time on the water as we could. I know what I'm doing. Yeah, it is smaller than this one—but it is just as beautiful."
^Mia laughs at the defensive tone that briefly entered Troy's voice.
intro_alexis: ^Alexis has a moderate level of experience.
^"I got my boating education certificate a few years ago. I had to, so I could drive my uncle's boat when we visited his lake cabin. So I've got the certificate and experience."
intro_julian: ^"I started the boat education course but haven't finished it. Still, I'm sure I know what I'm doing. I've been out on the water hundreds of times!"
believe_julian_q: ^Should Mia believe Julian has been on the lake "hundreds of times"?
julian_exaggerate: ^  Julian does have a tendency to exaggerate. Troy is fully aware of this. He turns to Julian and raises his eyebrows in mock-skepticism.
julian_ok_exaggerate: ^"OK, OK, so I've been boating just a handful of times. But I'm a really quick learner!"
intro_mia: ^"I've never been on a boat before. I did skim a boating safety study guide last night, but I'm still a little nervous." She notices Troy's expression of concern. "Oh, don't worry—I'm still excited. I've been looking forward to this for ages."
^Does Mia have anything to be nervous about?

c: ^, her previous study will help, and she's with more experienced boaters. But she needs to stay alert, to make a point of flagging worries up to her friends in case she has noticed something they have not, and to pay attention to the most experienced boater, Troy.
^, it would be better if she'd completed an official boating safety course before boating.
^, but if she stays alert, wears a personal flotation device (PFD), and follows the guidance of her friends, Mia should be fine.
^The Boat Ed Course Study Guide is available for you to help Troy, Alexis, Julian, and Mia at any point during the adventure.
^ To access the Study Guide, just touch the gear icon in the top right corner and then choose "Study Guide."

^"I wish," responds Troy. "Na, she's my brother's. But mine for the day."
alx_reacts: ^"She's fantastic!" Alexis eyes the vessel from bow to stern.

longest: ^Right! The length of a vessel is measured from the bow to the stern.

c: ^ It is important to know the length of a boat because its length determines what equipment a vessel must be equipped with to comply with the law.

want_review_pob: ^Before the friends board the boat, let's confirm that you understand the common terms and definitions associated with the parts of a boat.
widest: ^Oops, no. Bow to stern are the parts of a boat used to measure length, not a vessel's width, or beam. The beam of a ship is its width at the widest point.
pob_post_review: ^Great! Now that you've reviewed the parts of the boat, let's see what you know.
aboard_first_time: ^"Wow, it feels larger than it looks," Alexis says.
^"It sure does," Mia adds. "How many people can the Lakesong hold?"

^Troy shakes his head. "Nope. That only applies to boats 20 feet or under."
^"So how can you know what's safe?" responds Mia.

It also depends on conditions, and how the boat is loaded," Troy explains. "Anyone who's spent a significant amount of time on the water can tell when a boat is overloaded."

^"Sounds like it should have been fun," says Mia.
sounds_fun: ^"It should have been. But the Captain was inexperienced," Troy continues.

bad_decision: ^"Trying to race the storm to shore turned out to be a bad decision," declares Troy. "When we couldn't see the shore nor any sign of the channel markers after all that time, I should have realized we wouldn't get back to shore before the storm."
